notes:
1. Atmospheric Hazards

The primary goal of gas detection is to alert personnel to atmospheric hazards before they become dangerous. The main types of hazards are:

  • Oxygen Deficiency/Enrichment: Normal air contains ~20.9% oxygen. OSHA defines an oxygen-deficient atmosphere as less than 19.5% O2 (risk of asphyxiation). Oxygen-enriched atmospheres (>23.5%) increase flammability risk.
  • Combustible Gases: Gases capable of igniting and burning (e.g., methane, propane, hydrogen).
  • Toxic Gases: Gases that are poisonous or harmful to health (e.g., Carbon Monoxide (CO), Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S)).

2. Flammability Limits

Combustible gases will only burn within a specific range of concentrations in air.

  • Lower Explosive Limit (LEL) or Lower Flammable Limit (LFL): The minimum concentration of gas in air needed for the mixture to be flammable. Below this, the mixture is too lean.
  • Upper Explosive Limit (UEL) or Upper Flammable Limit (UFL): The maximum concentration above which the mixture is too rich to burn.

Gas detectors typically display combustible gas readings as a percentage of LEL. An alarm is usually set at 10% LEL.

3. Sensor Technologies

  • Catalytic Bead: The most common sensor for combustible gases (LEL). It works by burning the gas on a heated coil, changing its resistance. It requires oxygen to work.
  • Infrared (IR): Detects hydrocarbon gases by measuring the absorption of IR light. It works in inert atmospheres (no oxygen needed) and is immune to sensor poisoning.
  • Electrochemical: Used for toxic gases (CO, H2S) and oxygen. A chemical reaction generates a current proportional to the gas concentration.
  • Photoionization Detector (PID): Used for Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) at very low (ppm) levels.

solvedExamples.question: The Lower Explosive Limit (LEL) of methane is 5% by volume. If a gas detector reads '50% LEL', what is the actual concentration of methane in the air?
solvedExamples.explanation: The reading is a percentage of the LEL, not the volume percentage. 50% of the LEL means the concentration is half of the LEL value. Since the LEL is 5%, half of that is 2.5% methane by volume.

solvedExamples.question: Which type of sensor is commonly used to detect toxic gases like Carbon Monoxide (CO) and Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S)?
solvedExamples.explanation: Electrochemical sensors are the standard for detecting toxic gases at parts-per-million (ppm) levels. Catalytic bead sensors are used for combustible gases (LEL levels).

solvedExamples.question: An atmosphere is considered oxygen-deficient by OSHA standards if the oxygen concentration falls below:
solvedExamples.explanation: OSHA defines an oxygen-deficient atmosphere as one containing less than 19.5% oxygen by volume. Normal air is 20.9%. Below 19.5%, cognitive and physical impairments can begin.
